carlstm

Interface Transaction<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - return type of the transaction (Void if no return type)
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleTransaction.MyTransaction

    public interface Transaction<T>
    A transaction is a subprogram for which operations on TxObjects are atomic (all-or-nothing) and isolated (no intervening operations by other threads). Create a transaction by implementing this interface and writing an run() method that contains the transactional code, and execute the transaction by passing the implementing class to CarlSTM.execute(carlstm.Transaction<T>). For example: 
     class MyTransaction implements Transaction<Integer> {
        TxObject<Integer> x;
 
        MyTransaction(TxObject<Integer> x) {
                this.x = x;
        }
 
        public Integer run() throws NoActiveTransactionException,
                        TransactionAbortedException {
                int value = x.read();
                x.write(value + 1);
                return value;
        }
 
        public static void main(String[] args) {
                TxObject<Integer> x = new TxObject<Integer>(0);
                int result = CarlSTM.execute(new MyTransaction(x));
                System.out.println(result);
        }
 }

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T run()
      The main computation performed by this transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        T run()
      throws NoActiveTransactionException,
             TransactionAbortedException
        The main computation performed by this transaction.
        Returns:
        the result of executing the transaction
        Throws:
        NoActiveTransactionException - may be thrown if called outside of CarlSTM.execute(carlstm.Transaction<T>)
        TransactionAbortedException - if the transaction aborts mid-run.
